title: Recipes for When You’re Sick
description: Recipes for When You’re Sick! Are YOU or someone you know currently under the weather? (awwww I’m sorry I hope you feeling better!) Under the weather? What does that even mean? “Under the weather is an idiom that means “feeling sick or unwell.” It’s often used to explain that someone is ill without having to go into details. “ Saying I’m not feeling 100% also works. First, here’s a friendly reminder: I tell my son that the second he walks into the house. Another thing my Mom would have said. Are you getting enough fluids? Besides Emergen-C+ bubbly water (great combination btw), I go right for soups & other healing beverages. Let’s talk Chicken Soup Get yourself a rotisserie chicken and some vegetables. CHICKEN SOUP FOR THE SOUL. I have some in my fridge and freezer right now at the ready. Stracciatella Soup This is what my grandma used to make us when we weren’t feeling well. There are like 4 ingredients max. Amaze! Ramen is also a very good choice. I just found this from 9 years ago) Cooper was 7. Here’s some ramen! You can doctor it up: Mushroom Ramen This one has mushrooms and kimchi. Smoked Salmon Ramen Also a good option. Add hot sauce! Sausage White Bean Soup This is my Italian penicillin. Coconut Curry Chicken Soup This soup has helped me through so MUCH. I can make it in my sleep. Spring Minestrone with Chicken Meatballs This soup reminds me of being a kid. Alphabet soup forevs. Sidekick Tomato Soup Speaking of being a kid. I always loved tomato soup & grilled cheese when I was little. Sometimes you just need comfort. Coconut Carrot Soup I would probably add some ginger to this if you’re sick. It’s so smooth and silky. Bright Green Smoothie Talk about immunity boost! Lemon Ginger Zinger A cup of HEALTH. A good way to get ginger in your body. Fire Cider I take a shot glass full of this fire cider at the start of a cold. Sometimes I mix it with sparkling water for a spritzer. Lemon Ginger Elixir I made this all year long. Maybe that’s why I don’t get sick much. Ginger Brew This will knock the sickies out of you. Kale Apple Juice Bust out your juicer, let’s PROCESS VEGGIES and drink them. Turmeric Hot Toddy This hot toddy (pictured here with tequila) will help you sleep well. It’s super soothing on the throat too. OK, bonus recipes! Lime Sorbet If you need something to soothe the throat, this sorbet will do the trick. Add a scoop of bubbly water and now you’re talking. Citrus Smoothie Bowls Last but not least. Smoothie bowls! They’re a great way to get citrus in your body. Those are some of my favorite Recipes for When You’re Sick! I hope you or your loved one feels better. The post Recipes for When You’re Sick appeared first on Shutterbean.
excerpt: Tracy Benjamin of Shutterbean shares Recipes for When You're Sick. Here are all of the things that will boost your immune system!

html:
Recipes for When You’re Sick!

Are YOU or someone you know currently under the weather? 

(awwww I’m sorry I hope you feeling better!)

Under the weather? What does that even mean? 

“Under the weather is an idiom that means “feeling sick or unwell.” It’s often used to explain that someone is ill without having to go into details. “

Saying I’m not feeling 100% also works.

First, here’s a friendly reminder:

I tell my son that the second he walks into the house. 

Another thing my Mom would have said.

Are you getting enough fluids?  

Besides Emergen-C+ bubbly water (great combination btw), I go right for soups & other healing beverages. 

Let’s talk

Chicken Soup

Get yourself a rotisserie chicken and some vegetables. CHICKEN SOUP FOR THE SOUL. 

I have some in my fridge and freezer right now at the ready. 

Stracciatella Soup

This is what my grandma used to make us when we weren’t feeling well. There are like 4 ingredients max. Amaze!

Ramen is also a very good choice. I just found this from 9 years ago) Cooper was 7.

Here’s some ramen! You can doctor it up: 

Mushroom Ramen

This one has mushrooms and kimchi. 

Smoked Salmon Ramen

Also a good option. Add hot sauce! 

Sausage White Bean Soup 

This is my Italian penicillin. 

Coconut Curry Chicken Soup

This soup has helped me through so MUCH. I can make it in my sleep. 

Spring Minestrone with Chicken Meatballs

This soup reminds me of being a kid. Alphabet soup forevs. 

Sidekick Tomato Soup

Speaking of being a kid. I always loved tomato soup & grilled cheese when I was little. 

Sometimes you just need comfort. 

Coconut Carrot Soup

I would probably add some ginger to this if you’re sick. It’s so smooth and silky. 

Bright Green Smoothie

Talk about immunity boost!

Lemon Ginger Zinger 

A cup of HEALTH. A good way to get ginger in your body. 

Fire Cider

I take a shot glass full of this fire cider at the start of a cold. Sometimes I mix it with sparkling water for a spritzer. 

Lemon Ginger Elixir

I made this all year long. Maybe that’s why I don’t get sick much. 

Ginger Brew

This will knock the sickies out of you. 

Kale Apple Juice

Bust out your juicer, let’s PROCESS VEGGIES and drink them. 

Turmeric Hot Toddy

This hot toddy (pictured here with tequila) will help you sleep well. It’s super soothing on the throat too. 

OK, bonus recipes! 

Lime Sorbet

If you need something to soothe the throat, this sorbet will do the trick. Add a scoop of bubbly water and now you’re talking. 

Citrus Smoothie Bowls

Last but not least. Smoothie bowls! They’re a great way to get citrus in your body. 

Those are some of my favorite Recipes for When You’re Sick!  I hope you or your loved one feels better.
